column4: does it matter that it says "firmware=n/a" in the reponce from sudo -C network?
what is the trick to enabling a wired network card?
and you did of course do a sudo with it? do you have a gui?
isn't  there a nice program in the gui to control the nics?
if you had a working link before, that really shouldn't matter
I'd say that your nic isn't correctly installed anyway..
thats what I'm trying to determine, but I guess I don't know the right place to look
where can I see IRQ conflicts?
ifconfig eth[nr] gives you the right stuff
I'd say, check in windows and look if that's the same
and doublecheck it's the right drivers.
is it a 'normal' nic? search for issues with the card .. don't know much else to say =/
